G2mu7IlNurA5M4E5xkfGlg.text: The best food from any bar I've been to in the 'Burgh!  Everything I've had on the menu has been fantastic and I've eaten there quite a bit. My favorite is a tie between the Chicken Quesadilla and the Bavarian Club.  You wont go home hungry...a lot of food for a good price.  The wings are awesome and the beer selection is absolutely top notch. Over 30 beers on tap...if you like beers that most bars don't carry, you definitely want to check this place out.   Definitely worth checking this place out. You won't be disappointed.

vpdsy-SKfsaiseS-TuNlfA.text: I Just found Cain's about two months ago - love it! Great service, very friendly and the best food I've had in the south hills.  Their draft beer selection is good and tastes great (hate flat draft beer) Bloody Mary Bar on weekends is amazing! Good seating and a nice mixed crowd. We didn't know what to expect when we tried their breakfast, but it is as good as Grand Concourse - no exaggerating - we will definitely be regulars. Cain's truly is family friendly, which is why we first tried it and we love it.  The chef always walks past and asks how your food is - great touch!

SxYJOQrHBBg3j9IGn_tRrQ.text: Love the smoked salmon! Excellent. Nice craft beer selection. Fresh food each time I dine. I do wish they had more vegetarian options.

GAcvfBswyinTfMsPuLBDsQ.text: Just brought home a "steak hoagie". If you like bad steak in a bun with nothing else on it then this is your hoagie. No lettuce, no cheese, no nothing. I am shocked and surprised and totally disappointed.

367c2DsXsI0KY7Gc5WXqVw.text: We've been here a number of times and I still don't know why we come back.  Anything dealing with food is a train wreck.  The wait is always an hour or more, and the last 4 times several of the people at the table had to return their food because it was not cooked, or over cooked (burnt is what it was).  Today after waiting an hour and a half the food came out cold.  We sent the fried chicken back because it was so cold, and when the new plate came out, it was hot but raw in the center.  I'm done eating here.  I may come to have drinks, but never to eat.  Eat here at your own risk.  You've been warned!  If I could less than a star I would.

JbmpjUuBz5X39t9KGX0BfQ.text: I ordered a burger and sweet potato fries, my burger was pink on the inside..not how I like to eat them.  Our waitress was initially very helpful and took it back to the kitchen to have them cook it longer for me.  25 minutes later my date had finished his meal and my fries were gone.  Our waitress never returned to let me know what was going on, when she did I ended up asking her to just box my burger up for me to go thinking I would eat it for lunch the next day.  When I re-heated the supposedly re-cooked burger the following day it was still pink on the inside.  So I am not sure what the kitchen had been doing for 25 minutes but it was not cooking my burger.  We will not be returning here!

dzfZrr3M3El2LvvzUDAG8Q.text: Stopped in for breakfast today.  Pros:  -we were seated almost immediately, and it was crowded!   -the meals we got were great!  Cons: -service was super slow. We waited over 10 minutes for a server to take drink orders after we were seated. I had told my wife that we were going to leave if someone didn't come over in 3 minutes more. It wasn't just our server, it seemed like many tables were waiting a long time.

gBkc5EHiOPnNBJQVNqsp0g.text: We go here quite often for lunch. The food is excellent. Service is friendly, but spotty. If your in a hurry for lunch, I would advise you call ahead. I think perhaps the time it takes is because food is made to order. A great thing for the quality and taste but not so much if you have a limited amount of time. The lunch specials are a fantastic deal, and no matter what else I get , I get the spinach salad. It's scrumptious. Definitely recommend this place. Dinner I have had a couple times and the food was good, but the lunch deals are awesome!

ZTbVlQJTviS3XIvYhN5DZA.text: I really wish I could give this shit hole a zero but I have to give something. First we get in at 7 pm and after where seated we wait a good 15 mins for our waiter to show up to take our beer orders. Another 15 mins later and still no beer, another 5 mins we finally get the beer and of course everyone's beer is flat. Another god damn 15 mins later still no beer or waitress to take our food order. Finally after about an hour we get set with our beers and food, our damn food is ice cold. At this point I'm fed up along with everyone else and we call over the manager. This little dick head comes over and starts yelling at the four of us saying we either have a choice to eat or get out. We were more than happy to get the hell out of there with the shitest service and cold ass food ever. The long and short of it is that if you want to have a even good or a sorta good experience at diner without being told by a manager that I should stop talking, do not ever go to this place. Never ever go to this place if you even want to have a meal, or a hot meal if I should say, because this place will bend you over, grab the broom by the handle and sweep your ass out the door with it.   I've never had someone esp a manager tell me to eat or get out. That's all I have to say.

kij1XDWcHeObJ7q5VEnR6w.text: My husband and I love Cain's Saloon. The food is great, the drink selection is quite good, and it's a great atmosphere to watch a football and/or hockey game. We come here quite often.

0UuD2JuydpM4H215JExbJg.text: Very delicious meal! My husband has been here before, but it was my first time. The food and service was wonderful. Very nice, casual, and inexpensive place. We'll definitely be back!

o2i2fJ9MSVeF0QD1lfqqTQ.text: So yeah the wings are good just know some sauce choices are a dry rub. The fries are fresh cut, not hot when they came out   Oh ps no losers here, good atmosphere!

amRNDj8hhE2-6cxdCAqJbQ.text: Cain's Saloon has very good buffalo hot wings and sandwiches.  It gets a little noisy and crowded on the weekends, but the food is great.

3s30e9pp2IEFxeQqlHnD6A.text: I love Cain's. The night time staff is the best. Especially John. Great food. They made me and my girlfriend regulars there. I am very happy everytime I walk in. If anyone reads this and you decide to go then please get the Brisket Sandwich. It is amazing. I have never moaned while eating, but while eating this sandwich I did.

LX720IUmEX8A_nF8gNZQ0g.text: It was our first visit to Cains and we were very pleased. Food was very good and reasonably priced. We will be back if ever in Dormont

yRjyU1z7T-rgvnS5Xg9K7A.text: Good local bar with lots of TVs, good draft selection, and better than average bar food. Definitely a step up from the Saloon.

NEC7s8Y41KSTufg7KMTDZA.text: Draft selections are good...service is lousy...food is sub par. Not in a hurry to return.

2x_W6DhSuAD3FTbVc-HupQ.text: I would give this place half a star if I could. The service was the most appalling I have ever experienced. We ordered sandwiches and fries and waited a FULL HOUR for our food. After 30 minutes of waiting we had to glad down our waitress to find out how much longer, she laughed it off and said there were three tickets in front of us still. Our veggie burgers and fries came out cold but by that point we wear starved and not about to send our precious food back to that black hole of a kitchen, where apparently time doesn't exist. The waitress gave us our check, stated that the manager would not do anything for us for the long wait and she "did what she could" and discounted $5 from our $55 bill. HA! We requested to speak with the manager who avoided us for 10 minutes before she came over and made excuses about it being busy and other people ordering specialty items. She continued to make excuses and said the best she would do is discount 10%. What a joke. I would never go back here if someone paid me.

RtFnoTDwfO1_3EHy97Zp3w.text: The food is mediocre. There is nothing special about this place. It's in Dormont, trying to be Mt. Lebanon and a lost cause. It's like every other sports bar, and there are several which I prefer to this one!  Go there if you want to leave sorry that you wasted your money.  Most of the staff is also rude (complaining about making Irish Car Bombs, or accusing patrons of being "shady" if they join a table).  The staff that isn't rude is indifferent. And none of them are aesthetically pleasing enough to have this attitude.  Two weeks later and still NO response from the business and Yelp! won't post my review because they are bias and political.

2NCqxMavCYcHZXpxdSUyBg.text: My husband & I have been here probably a dozen times.  Never once have we had a bad experience.  The menu has a large variety, and everything we've tried has been excellent!...best wings I've ever eaten!!!   Portions are huge and very reasonably priced.  Huge beer selection.  Bartendars are quick & friendly.  Great place to watch games....tons of TV's.     Only con:  The bar area isn't that big, so it fills up quickly.  Oh, and the parking lot that was across the street, is no longer there!

SPmIwmxQHBnDNG6mpuEyMw.text: Rising prices here have made my review drop. The menu changes on build your own burgers and omelets were basically designed to nickel and dime you into buying a $13-$20 instead of just having something like a western omelet or bacon cheeseburger.   I thoroughly enjoy the build your own bloody Mary bar and 35 wing night here. But prepare to pay 50 for each ranch and $1.50 for 4 carrot sticks or celery, what a ripoff.   Sports events are great here with all the big screen TVs as well as the beer selection and specials.   My favorite side is the sweet potatoe fries and the portions are enormous. Service here is usually very attentive even when the place is packed.

Aqx_hWgwqbPFgpwUuAS5aA.text: It's a nice neighborhood diner, the food quality was descent and portions are pretty big.

A4ZEjbFuvWjqW7NxMxBGnQ.text: Great breakfast!  Been going here for breakfast for 3 years and it never disappoints.  The sausages are some of the best around and in general everything from the omelet to the pancakes are tasty and filling.  The bacon is thick and delicious.  Good coffee to boot.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

tC3IEUzTL87nHglOD1CZrQ.text: Sad to say I have to come back and edit my review and take it way down. The service here has gone downhill and the kitchen is slow. Holidays are always going to be busy, that's understandable. So we made a reservation last week and requested a high chair at that time.  Upon arrival, we were told we'd have to wait 15 minutes (which was closer to 30) for our table (despite the reservation). They told us the kitchen was slow and they were short staffed. No problem, we waited.   Once we were seated, we were handed menus and silverware and I was told they'd get me a high chair as soon as one was available. Slowly over the next hour and a half we got drinks (thanks to their truly kind bartender), then food. But no high chair. With a squirmy infant, it was very difficult to eat or drink a cup of coffee. At one point, about an hour after we were seated, I noticed that a previous table had left but we weren't given their high chair. So I found a waitress and asked her where I could get one. She said she'd return with one shortly. She never did. What she did do, though, was complain loudly (with her manager) to the table behind me about how the previous table she had was rude to her. Having witnessed the aforementioned interaction, I can say they were rude to her... unfortunately her manager was rude right back to them which only fueled the fire. I feel for her, I do, but to complain about another customer is also rude and unprofessional.   The food is decent. Nothing I can't cook at home. But we've been going to Cain's for years and while we've watched it go downhill, we stayed loyal because we used to have such good experiences there. Not anymore, though. The slow service is understandable and par for the course when dining on a holiday. But listening to a manager give attitude to customers and then shit talk them once they left to other customers.... not cool.

F_2gF-xFmAsQvt39AgH3zw.text: Love this place. Amazing selection of draft beers. Food is average. The Bloody Mary bar on Sunday's and their breakfast is great! Atmosphere and service is always good too. Plenty of seating and the bar itself is large also.

J4IES8IZBGv0Gxi4YvBP4w.text: It's hit or miss for me. I used to love their breakfast but when I went the other day it just was not the same. Menu definitely changed. Lots and I mean lots of regulars. They're opening the top floor which will be nice but hopefully doesn't bring even more regulars, but that's what businesses like this thrive off of so I can respect that.   Lunch/Dinner/Apps are great. Wide selection and fair prices. Although when I sit in the bar I would prefer not to have the tables right next to the bathroom. When people come in and out you constantly get the lingering smell of toiler bowl cleaner mixed with your food.

GgNVnpfetpuBzw2D1B3zqQ.text: Cain's is a TREASURED INSTITUTION in Dormont, and of course, it's a neighborhood favorite  It's a lot better for those of us who don't live in Dormont now that there is a parking lot across the street, but do be careful if you are attempting to cross West Liberty Avenue during rush (happy) hour!  I've been stopping at Cain's since I can't remember when, and maybe their tap selection has something to do with that.  I have never failed to find something interesting and crafty on tap at Cain's.  My favorite night to stop at Cain's is Wednesday.  I try to get there early, because later in the evening, the place is usually packed out, even though there is a lot of seating.  On Wednesdays, Cain's has a special on their excellent chicken wings.  They are done the right way, and among my top favorites in the South Hills.  You can't go wrong at Cain's during happy hour.  Half price on all appetizers and a dollar off all drinks from 5 to 7.  But my favorite plan of attack at Cain's is to arrive around 4:45 and order the "half sandwich and a soup" deal they call "express lunch."  It is served until 5:00, and you can't beat a half sandwich and two sides for $5.99.  By the time my food arrives, it's happy hour and the beers are a buck off, but you have to be seated in the bar area, supposedly.  My favorite sandwich to get with this deal is the Reuben, served with some volcano chili and slaw, but I've had other interesting sandwiches there as well.  The chili has got some NICE punch to it, and I am definitely a fan.  I remember way back when this place wasn't so pretty, but they have done a nice job with updating the place and you won't be embarrassed to bring a date to this place.  But don't be surprised if you end up having to stand for quite a while before you can get a seat on a Wednesday night.  Chivalry is not dead in Dormont, which is one of my favorite parts of the South Hills, and I have seen young men give up their seats in favor of older ladies at Cain's.  Good people.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Be prepared to MOVE QUICKLY if you are crossing West Liberty Avenue during rush hour to get a beer at Cain&#39;s!
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Plenty of INTERESTING and CRAFTY TAPS at Cain&#39;s Saloon!

O5_wbjYrxhhgfPJcCoshfQ.text: The service sucks!! My boyfriend and I went to eat a late dinner (after 8pm) and the place was busy but still that is no need for the service to suck! We sat down in the back and waited for someone to come say hi and to get a drink order. Once we finally got acknowledged we ordered and waited well over an hour for our food. After an hour we got fed up and stood up to leave and to complain to the manager. People who sat down after us got their food so we were upset. I went to the bar and asked for the manager and the guy bartending was one. I told him what happened and he said he was sorry we waited and that they had two call offs. The waitress came up and said our food was here but we didn't want it and left. I won't be back. They need to get better service...

obOuz18sfanD6WfXbKoz0Q.text: I really should give this 1 start but I hate to do that and their food is not bad. It's the service-they just can't get it right.  We went for breakfast on a Sunday morning around 10 and it was busy but not packed. Well you would have thought it was Super Bowl Sunday with the Steelers winning they way the wait staff was acting. We were seated and a booth opened up right after we sat down so we jumped at the chance to move. Our waitress greeted us and apologized that they just seated all the tables in her section at once and she would be with us as soon as she can. It was a few minutes later that she took our order-ok no problem. We all got eggs of some sort. Well 40 minutes later we are starting to get restless and other tables that came in after us are getting served. We asked our waitress multiple times what is going on and she apologized and said she should have told us from the beginning that it takes a minimum of 45 minutes to get your food. Seriously are you kidding?  That is crazy for eggs even on the busiest of days.  After an hour and ten minutes had passed we could wait no longer and were headed out the door-I have never done this before but it was getting ridiculous.  On our way out the waitress stopped us as our food was there.  I got an egg, cheese and bacon sandwich on a bagel. It was not bad.  My fiance ordered a steak and cheese sandwich with a friend egg and they forgot the fried egg. He was so hungry by this point it did not even matter.  The waitress apologized again as she knew we were not happy. We asked her 3 different times for the manager and he never once came to see us.  On top of all of that they did not even give us a free orange juice, We had to pay for the entire meal.  On our way out the waitress said she hopes this will not prevent us from coming back-well it does unfortunately. We had 2 guests from out of town with us that were appalled by this service.  I was also really disappointed with the manager for not taking the time to settle this-all it would have taken was a free entree or two.  The only thing I can end with is I recommend you stay away from this place for brunch and know going in you will have bad service because the food is pretty good.

Zd7oWcYNc_HZ9hkvpmQqLw.text: I used to love this place now its disgusting.  The last 3 times we went we hated it. Freezer burnt, old, bland, food. The cheese balls aren't even the same! What a waste of money on garbage food.  Disgusting! Save yourself and go almost anywhere else!

6t-gaI2NjQBOBi2H7LlILw.text: It was ok. Food was good Service not bad. Didn't appreciate the ceiling fans blowing on my food. Coffee good.

fvvroJEmSHhAN-LSc4C6HQ.text: Well, we literally live 2 minutes away and decided to try breakfast. It was myself, my wife, my cousin and his girlfriend together for a birthday brunch. It was about 1/2-3/4 full, not surprising for a Sunday. The arrived shortly before us and when we got there it took about 15 minutes to just to get coffee and water. I felt badly for our server Anita, who was nice but obviously stressed. I ordered 2 eggs fried hard, wheat toast and homefries; the wife ordered a French toast bowl, and I ordered donuts for the table. After waiting a considerable amount of time the donuts arrived; obviously the oil wasn't hot enough because they were soaked all the way through. So between the 4 of us we ate about 2.5 before the grease just became way too much. After another bit, our orders arrived. My eggs were far from the 'fried hard' that I ordered, and my wife didn't even get the right thing. I couldn't eat my eggs because the runnier, the grosser...to me and again not what I ordered. The toast was luke warm and the homefries had clearly been sitting alone in a dark corner asking for forgiveness before arriving at my table. Now my wife's dilemma. She ordered a french toast bowl with apples and pecans...what did she get? French toast triangles with canned apples on top. Seriously. She took a bite and immediately had to excuse herself; she got sick due to the oil in the donuts...as we don't normally eat greasy stuff; donuts shouldn't be dripping in grease. Regardless, the waitress was busy enough that we didn't see her often but once she stopped by I told her to go ahead and take my plate because the order wasn't cooked right, and she took it off the bill. Then when my wife's order was addressed she admitted that it was rung up wrong and what my wife got wasn't even on the menu; she hadn't even taken three bites of it and she didn't offer to take it off the menu....which is what should have been done. My wife had already gone home at this point so I just wanted to pay and get home to make sure she was okay. Never saw a manager, the food was terrible, staff was scant and it was just a bad time. Perhaps it was an off day, but after this I don't know that I will be up for giving it another shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Not quite what I asked for

mlQe06A4vHKb_xznN9SG8A.text: One week night we wanted to step out of the norm and try something different for us. Enter Cain's Saloon. Really... We entered Cain's Saloon. That sounds dirty but you know what I mean.   It was pretty busy in the initial bar area which has a bar to the left and tables to the right. While we prefer to sit at the bar we knew this would end up being a dining room trip based on the ongoing March Madness and the time we got there (Happy Hour). Our wait to be seated was really short and even the tables (rather than booths) feel roomy in the dining room. There are approximately 100 giant TVs inside between the bar and dining room. Well, ok, maybe not 100... but it's close maybe 97 TVs. This is a great place to watch whatever Sportball game your into, even in the dining room.   As soon as we were seated it started to really fill up. The place looks small but it fits a lot of people. While waiting for our waitress to come get our drink order I saw they used an online listing for the over 30 on tap craft beers. I love this because it allowed us to decide before she even got to us. They have a happy hour special of half price appetizers and Wednesday's are wing night.   We both ordered wings; mine boneless and his bone in (it's ok you can laugh, I'm 12 too). They took a while to come out due to how busy they were but they were so delicious. I was so happy with the food and how attentive our waitress was even though it was insanely busy.    The food prices were great, the beer/drink options are awesome, the staff is friendly, and the interior is darker and cozy. We will absolutely be back.

LkIbCRstuyzLzHU-9YtjhQ.text: Have been going to Cain's for close to 10 years.  Loved their brunch, until today.  Kitchen got backed up, so it took over an hour to get our food.  No big deal.  Understood that happens.  Then when the food started rolling out, we had two separate hairs tangled in our food.  Since we were pretty grossed out, we asked for to-go containers for the food not impacted with hair & asked for the manager.  The manager came & said none of his cooks have hair & comped one of the dishes w/hair.  Will never go back.  Sad cause we've had good memories there over the years.

jSIvFOG1nVsSfXmjeq9EFw.text: I've had countless bad experiences with this place... it's a shame because the food is good. It's just poorly managed and owned.   I went to school at south hills beauty academy it is located next door and I would order lunch every week. When you eat in you get good portions for the price, although if you decide to get a Togo order they will over charge you and give you 1/4 of the food you would receive by dining in. For example I ordered a salad Togo and got 8 pieces of lettuce.  Another example.... One day on my lunch break I had 30 extra minutes so instead of picking up my Togo order I kindly asked the owner if he minded if I ate my meal there. He said that would be no problem... so I ordered a drink and when the waitress brought it to me she rudely said "next time you order Togo food you better not eat it here" I kindly told her the owner told me it was ok and she responded "he sent me over here to tell you because he's so pissed that you would make us waste togo containers"  I then asked the waitress to go get the owner and I saw her talking to him but he never was brave enough to talk to me. I thought this was very distasteful and made me feel really uncomfortable.  Overall a very shady place and the workers are childish/petty!

Xa9n5ZFjxmQZE7Sk3qKQBw.text: if 0 stars was an option that would be the rating on this review. the second we entered the establishment, we were greeted by an extremely rude bald headed bouncer. made snide comments regarding my license expiring in 3 weeks, which is plenty of time to get a new license IMO. we had a group of 6 people and several of their larger bar top tables available. however, we were then scolded by several workers for blocking the aisle with 2 people sitting at the middle seats at the table and not even all 6. 2 gentleman were nice enough to switch us tables so we could be on the end and not "block any aisles". we proceeded to order drinks which were awful and flat. i had to go up to the bar because the servers were not great and not coming up to our table to inform the bartender the drinks were flat. however, both bartenders declined making the drinks and told me there is no possible way that soda water could be flat ever. 5 minutes later i was informed i was indeed correct and the soda water was flat and they asked if we wanted new drinks. by that point we just wanted to get out of there because the experience was terrible. overall cains is not great. go to the saloon or jameson's.

bbXMuDhKwSyi6e_UUdfGhw.text: We haven't been to Cain's in awhile so decided to give it a whirl. We made our way through the bar and back to the restaurant. I was checking out people's food as we walked by. It looked good and people looked like they were enjoying their food. Our waitress's name was K.K.  She was very friendly and she was very attentive. She showed us the appetizers on the menu as well as the wings and a few other things.  I ordered the Chicken Parm. First my salad came out. It had cucumbers, tomatoes, onions on top of Romain. I had Blue Cheese dressing and it was very good. Then the Chicken Parm came out. Oh my did it look good!  It was two huge pieces of chicken fried to the perfect crispness with sauce, and melted provolone. On one said their were two huge pieces of garlic toast and on the other was Angel hair pasta tossed in sauce. It was A LOT of food! The sauce on the pasta and chicken was very tasty. Sometimes sauces can be too tomatoey or bland but their sauce was great. The chicken was still juicy and the pasta was cooked perfectly.  My husband ordered the Mixed Grill with shrimp. It was mixed veggies that were grilled along with wild rice. It came with 7 nice sized shrimp. The dish was seasoned well and I think if I had not been with him he would have licked the plate.  I ended up taking over half of my food home. Doggie bags are always welcome at my house.
