Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Parm

DT1MLbGFCj9RrGufX-MGXw.text: I wish I could give them more stars, however despite the good food the service was horrible. We had to ask 3 times for waters, we had to get up and find the waitress to get our check, she said there was no way that she could split it (but came back with two separate receipts), and we had to go find her to give her our payment. Not impressed. If you work with the public at least fake it until you make it because you depend on those tips girl ;)

FvnFN7ZF4xNsRsDO-eWCUg.text: Food is excellent, drinks are too. But if you're coming on a Sunday- expect to wait atleast 45 minutes to an hour for your food. Just a heads ho

R3BhQdzm8Z-ba791T98WKQ.text: Our night at Cain started out as 4/5 stars.  This was my first visit and I was blown away by the extensive menu and attentive service.  I ordered the Shrimp and Strawberry salad - not something I would usually order at a bar.  But I was not disappointed! The shrimp were of a decent size and seasoned well. The salad was huge and at $12 was just right.  My guests ordered a variety of items including Buffalo Chicken dip (amazing); Spinach Artichoke Dip (great); and for their entrees - the Grilled Romaine salad topped with Filet; Surf and Turf ($14 - WHAT?); and a Steak and Egg something sandwich. Everyone seemed delighted with their respective meals and the drinks flowed all night long thanks to our wonderful server whose name I cannot recall.    Unfortunately, as the evening progressed the bouncer began his shift. Sigh.  I'm sorry, but he just wasn't nice. Not that bouncers need to be cuddly, but dang.  We were seated at the table closest to the door, a table which he clearly despises.  He rudely asked us (the two people seated in the outer seats) to move closer into the table when there was really nowhere for us to go; citing that patrons walking in couldn't do so with us sitting there. Lies.  There was plenty of room for anyone to walk anywhere.  He repeatedly got an attitude with one of our guests both vocally and with his body language; going so far as to seat his stool so close to our table that shoulders were touching. Get over yourself, dude.  I'll visit Cains again, but either won't go when there's a bouncer on duty (which is a ridiculous thing to have to do); or request a table away from the door and annoy the hostess. Either way, he's not a great ambassador for what I'm sure is a great place.

EvE95LEtRmit-i4NHD_zNQ.text: Great beer selection and awesome food ! Fun environment for sporting events! Servers and bartenders were all very nice too !

8I44BJupQFhosF59WS4N3g.text: Great specials from wing and shrimp night to brunch. They have a great menu, very good food, friendly staff and plenty of tvs. The only issue for me was parking isn't plentiful since its on street parking on West Liberty Avenue and the bathroom was a bit run down. I had bananas Fosters pancakes, bacon and a mimosa. They had fixins set up to add strawberries, blueberries and other fresh fruit. I loved it. The pancakes had a rum 4amd it was so outstanding I didn't eat syrup at all. The bacon was crispy and they gave me plenty. I enjoyed the server he's been there 17 years and he was a well versed on everything we asked. I'm looking forward to going back on a Wednesday for wings and shrimp. This place is great for sporting events there was a soccer game on when we were there so the tvs in the back had the game on while there was football in the bar area on the tvs. It was a nice blend and everyone was enjoying themselves. Its a feel good environment and I'm looking forward to going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bananas Fosters with rum sauce
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mimosa

KIgClUOPQp0Ib1W2QIgVrg.text: Ok.... Understand this was a prearranged bus bash stop at Cains. So, this was our first stop on St Pattys day with a party bus of 25 highly successful professionals from Southpointe...(ages 30-55). One of our dear friends who happens to be an Indian woman, age 30+ forgot her ID.   The bouncer was the most ignorant bouncer I've encountered in 35 years of visiting bars... A complete lack of professionalism. If he had worked for me I would have fired him on the spot.  Understand it was 15 degrees outside.  The bus dropped everyone off and was to pick us up an hour later.   This young lady had no coat, short skirt and short sleeves and this man tells her to stand outside in the cold.  Not cool. Within 30 minutes we had her ID... then he refuses to allow her in because she flipped him off as she stood outside in the cold...  Screw you guys at Cains.  Uncalled for....

dvdSTGJ4NdIvXkIJBM5ttA.text: Yelp notified me that they had removed my previous review (perhaps someone complained about it). Alas, I will repost and now it will won't be buried under newer reviews.   I once had love for Cain's Saloon. It was a place where everybody knew my name. I would often boast of the hearty breakfast, accompanied by a make-your-own bloody mary bar on Sundays. I would always suggest it when friends asked me where to go. I was excited to bring family there for dinner.   The beer selection is great, and the specials for Pirates games brought me by almost 162 times a year. I was a brand loyalist - spending hundreds if not thousands of dollars on a place that I believed in.   But something changed. Without warning, without reason, without the Cain's love that I had grown so accustomed to - I was treated extremely rudely by a specific bartender who I will not name. And now those friends who I once brought along, and the family I would laugh with while eating gigantic cheese sticks, and the strangers I would tell to try Cain's for breakfast are a thing of the past.   I cannot speak for others. I only know that deep down in the fragments of my broken heart, I cannot return to Cain's to spend another penny. Such a shame because between the guests I brought and the money I spent - I know it was a lot of money. So much money - gone. Like a big ball of revenue that was so constant and so kind and always huge tips for the friendly staff and I was even thinking about spending more money just because I loved giving them so much money.   All that money spent elsewhere because of one power trip.  Sometimes I drive past Cain's. It still looks the same. I think about the good times had. One day when this particular bartender leaves I might return.... (END)  Oh also tons of TVs great for watching every sports game. :)

r5m3v2_uRZS01dWuLYB2dQ.text: Came in on Wednesday. We were hoping to watch some baseball and this place delivered. In from out-of-town on business and we were struggling to find a place to watch the games. In a search of places with MLB Extra Innings in Pittsburgh, Cain's was on a short list. I can verify that they do, in fact, have the MLB Extra Innings and they use it to the fullest. I may not have always agreed with the changing of the stations that they selected, but it didn't affect my overall experience.   The had some beer specials, a great selection of craft beers, and Wednesday happened to be wing night - $.35 wings, traditional or boneless. A couple gripes here...they make you order at least 10/flavor. It kinda sucked because it was our first time in and they have a ton of different flavors that we wanted to try, but we were kind of limited. We got the cajun dry rub, the hot garlic parm, and orange ginger. The wings themselves were nice, meaty, not overly breaded...just how I like them. The flavors were a bit underwhelming. I don't know what it was, but they just didn't seem super flavorful. Almost like the flavor didn't stick to the wing. They looked amply sauced and rubbed...it was a real head-scratcher. Not bad, just wanted a little more punch to them. Regardless, can't complain about $.35 wings (even though I just did kinda).   I'd absolutely come back. Oh, it's worth noting that the bartender who worked the other night was awesome. Super attentive. Never went without a drink or a full water the entire night.

VOc4tS43hiJAuU6zzhAMwg.text: HELLO new neighborhood watering hole!    This place is legit!  Moving to the new hood in Dormont means finding a new go to bar.  I need a my hood bar to have a good selection of beer (I accept Yuengling and hopefully a rotating seasonal list) and good bar food.  Good bar food doesn't have to be good.  I mean, it has to be good, but it doesn't have be gourmet poutine, if you know what I'm sayin'?    Cain's totally surprised me because they have a mega beer list, with lots of drafts on tap, and this particular night Southern Tier Pumking was in the hizzouse!  Their menu is HUGE too!  Tons of faves like wings and burgers but the intriguing "Codfather," which I will take part in at some point!  I was in the mood for a Rachel, because well, why not... it's my name!    The Rachel was awesome, with a good amount of turkey, but not overwhelming and lots of coleslaw, which is totally how I like it!  The rye was fresh and toasted and it all came together perfectly.  But the fries, the fries win my seal of approval!  They were crisp and seasoned correctly, which is a winning fry in my opinion.    I'll see you soon Cains, and will be working my way through your extensive draft list and food menu on the reg!

ZJz12K8LZWfB32zv3XMfUQ.text: Average bar food, slow service, a nice selection of incredibly overpriced beers. My parents RAVED about this place from when they were regulars years ago, but needless to say when I have a hoagie & decent beer craving, I'll be going elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gBrjwehYu17oPZrvhMcJRw.text: Came to Cain's for a business lunch and was not disappointed! My companion selected the location and though I was skeptical, it turned out to be a great place for a meeting and a tasty bite.   We sat at a booth in the back section and it was quiet and well lit, perfect for a meeting. Our waitress was unobtrusive but made suggestions, pointing us towards the lunch special menu, which was awesome!   For 7.99 you have a TON of choices for a combo lunch that includes choices of sliders, half-sandwiches (great choices and a very large half!) and a warm and cold side. You even get to choose the bread for your sandwich.   I had the grilled chicken on italian bread with sides of sweet potato fries and fruit salad. My companion had a similar combo but with mac and cheese as the hot side.   The sandwich was large and filling and the chicken was perfectly seasoned and cooked. The bread was soft but toasted crispy. The sweet potato fries were the waffle variety and were just the right amount of crispy on the outside. The fruit salad had alot of variety and everything was fresh.   The mac and cheese was HUGE and looked really good. The combo was a GREAT DEAL any way you slice it.   I was really pleasantly surprised by Cain's and will definitely return when in the area.

ZhH3i9uu_7Vij18ESMFvrg.text: 1 hour wait for apps. Came with another couple. Half the group got their food, the other half got their food 15 minutes later. One of the workers fully admitted that they served the French fries that were "supposed to be thrown out" from the old owner. Awkward/gross? Won't be back now that it's new ownership. Our waitress was sweet though!!

oPhyGJ58Yy-aJ5hbOcLJKA.text: I came in this place with my girlfriend and tried to get dinner and was turned down at 6pm because she didn't have an ID. We didn't even want to sit at the bar or order drinks. So I guess make sure you have your ID if you want to get food. I will not be returning

bRvaT1tHM3aMrPdKtgf2WQ.text: HELLA SWEET BRUNCH!!  I really like Cains. I frequent this place for brunch. They have an excellent brunch drink menu which is pretty unique I think. Really great service and food to boot. Also , 33 beers on tap makes for a quality selection of brews. Good service and and atmosphere are a plus.   Great stuff

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brunch!

vVM5zOKEFlvM6xsR-BbjVw.text: My friends and I heard this place was a hidden gem, so we were excited to check it out for a penguin's game the other week. It is located in Dormont and very close to Mt. Lebanon, parking wasn't terrible for us to find at all considering there were a few parking lots close by. It wasn't too crowded at all and we were seated right away. Our waitress was fantastic and kept a great eye on us the whole time. We started off with three, yes three, appetizers. We ordered the wings (the Cajun bbq), mozzarella sticks and fried pickles. The wings were incredible. The sauce was almost overwhelming because they gave us so much of it, but it was tasty as well. The wings themselves were juicy & cooked perfectly. The mozzarella sticks were huge and veryyyyy packed full with cheese. The fried pickles were pretty standard, but were tasty none the less. I then had the Bavarian chicken club and a side of the veggies that day (sauteed zucchini with tomatoes). The chicken club was awesome- the mustard, pretzel bun & bacon were delicious & the chicken was thick but juicy. Super good. The veggies were decent, but I wouldn't order them again. I stole some French fries from a friend's plate- they were delicious (I heard a lot about them from some coworkers). Their draft list was also decent and was categorized by the type of beer, which is always helpful. I also should point out that the dining area had a ton of tv's- which my boyfriend clearly loved while watching the pen's game.  Overall, we had a great experience & I am looking forward to returning!

pxSr-8h_I1oapSXzLEj1YA.text: The wings were top notch, perfectly cooked and crispy. Freshly fried... honey habanero sauce was one of the best i've ever had. Service was also top notch. If you like sports, this place has TVs everywhere. I will definitely be back.

N-Tn4XKeBP2t_a7RGG2mMg.text: It's an alright place to drink, but don't order food. The food is always over cooked or burned. The prices are ridiculous for the quality you're getting. The service is decent. I don't go unless it's a last resort. Especially for food.

bzuRoyVlKpnLAXy2bkLD1Q.text: Awful. Every time I've been here, something has been served ice cold. This could be a great place but their food is mediocre at best. The only redeeming quality would be the bartenders and wait staff but unfortunately it's not enough to earn a return trip after so many failures. Spend your money elsewhere.

Ldrv3xxRNqCPvpO0MLO5Sw.text: Being born and raised in the south hills Cain's has always held a special place in my heart. I have been going there since the early 90s and continued to take my family there for Sunday brunch over the past few years. Service has always been slow but the quality and taste of the food has more than made up for the wait. However, this morning we had the worst experience of our life and sadly I can no longer give my money to the new management. We arrived at 11 for brunch with 4 adults and 2 kids. There was a party of about 10 people in the bar area and another large party (8) in the back. After waiting 15 minutes to get our drinks, we started to order. Months ago, the menu was cut to about 12 items (due to new management) but we were told the full menu would be back soon. The menu is still minuscule, the waffle maker was broke, they were out of cranberry juice, and it took forever to get coffee that was lukewarm at best. We ordered our food and so began the wait. After 45 minutes and seeing another table of 4 walk in, order, eat, and leave I asked the waiter where our food was. He told me "it will be out when it's ready."  I then spoke to the manager and explained our situation. He seemed concerned and went into the kitchen. A few minutes later our waiter came to our table and told us they were plating our food. I was in the restroom with one of my children when the food arrived. Orders were wrong (despite repeating them numerous times to the waiter) and 1/2 the food was missing. When my wife pointed out that one of the orders was wrong, the waiter tried to argue with her about it.  The food was mediocre. The home fries once house-made now come out of a bag. Finally our check came (the manager never checked on us). They charged us for every piece of food despite all the issues. Sadly due to this experience and options in the neighborhood we will never go to Cain's again.

ZMCL80HKWvFMp33IN5x_Kw.text: They are in transition to new ownership. Hopefully it gets better when complete. I have been a Caines patron for years, but today's experience was awful. Food was bad, waitstaff overworked. Not a fan any more

Dsr5hmUPguqxnZaIAqhIQA.text: I've gone to Cain's a few times and have never been disappointed. Friendly, fast service and great food. The food is above what you expect for your average bar food and the same goes for the prices.  An excellent selection of beers on tap and daily food specials.  I plan to try their Sunday Bloody Mary Bar soon so I can't review that but Cain's has an excellent week day happy hour.

I4lRcEkgiPiO5sABH-4tGQ.text: Been here a couple times for food, average at best. Everything on the menu is basic. Tried to stop for dinner on a Friday at 6:30 and was carded. My 32 year wife didn't have hers so weren't let in even though we were just eating. Bartender was rude and had no common sense. Cain's advertising as a restaurant but IDing that early in the evening makes no sense. I wouldn't waste my time here.

XW9GEyvxr6_31zVlV-U-1Q.text: Ate here for lunch today. Was really noisy due to two big parties. I ordered the turkey club with onion rings. Rings were awesome!! Sandwich was really good, turkey was really tender and flavorful. The bread was just toasted enough to give it texture without being hard.  My fiance had the 3 little pigs with the sweet potato waffle fries. He loved the sandwich. Also, both portions were huge!! I took home half my sandwich and probably 2/3 my onion rings.   I knocked off one star for service. We didn't have the issues that other people have had, but our waitress wasn't very friendly. I cannot stand when people in costumer service aren't friendly. Even when you're not having a bad day, you cannot take it out on the customer.   With all that being said, I'd definitely go back if I'm in the area again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Turkey club with onion rings. And this was just half of my order that I took home!

Wr4EMqhhE-CaP4dhI21TVQ.text: We always love Cain's!  Tonight may have been the exception.  I got my usual steak. Very disappointed!  So salty and thin and overdone, even by my expectations.  I've been known to send an uncooked steak back-not necessary tonight!  I grabbed a manager who was more than willing to make amends, free dinner, free dessert, free wine.  NO, I don't complain to get free food.  He gave me a glass of wine and took 10% off the check.  Then the bill comes and the big surprise--my husband's non alcoholic beer is $5.50 a bottle!!! For REAL??  We ask the server and she double checks.  YEP  the bartender said "ring it up as a microbrew"!!!!  I guess that makes up for the free wine and 10% off.  We'll be back, but on a Saturday when steak is the special and worth the price and we'll be drinking water!

1kL0UyNuzUAKSo2ExMjRPQ.text: The turkey sandwich on a pretzel bun is my go to meal here. So good. Fun people and a good atmosphere to watch a game

ApMsfDHW7HniSJA8q9qogw.text: Cains best thing by far is their breakfast.

O8dP-s5iO1LWCn2Ao_EMmg.text: Very good food! Friendly staff!  Tons of TV's for the games & a comfortable atmosphere. Always a great time!

G0pumVkXjwBJ2Ov9jvvfGQ.text: I've been to Cain's quite a few times, since I live right down the street.  The best times I have had at Cain's consist of myself going into the establishment with the predetermined mentality of spending way too much for drinks ( $7.00 for a Jameson and Ginger!!??) and already being three sheets to the wind.   Don't get me wrong, if you like going to a place that mildly reminds me more of a mosh pit at times than an actual drinking establishment, you would love Cain's. Definitely, avoid going on the weekends.  But, I will admit that Cain's is an awesome place to post up at the bar, drink a few beers, and catch a Pen's game on one of their million TV's.   Bottom line : This place is not a place where you and your buds can go and get poopy drunk at. Cains is, at best, a bar where you stop during a bar crawl for a beer and a shot.   Nothing more, and nothing less.

xjl2LGFS_podAT0p-udcTA.text: My favorite place in Dormont/Mt Lebanon area. Stuff is fantastic. Food will surprise you: better than most restaurants.

LT-I560QFgqWfzeoqB_iCw.text: Used to go there weekly when I was in college. When it was just a bar. Went there for breakfast on father's day for breakfast and it was fantastic ! One if the best I've ever had. Huge menu.  They've really cleaned the place up. I would highly recommend a visit.

-w49EJEVBjaEtBgKKzavlg.text: Yum.   I love when places surprise you! Brunch is my passion so I am always on the hunt for new spots. I love the Pamela's scene but sometimes you need that bloody mary to hold you off until you can dig into your home fries.   BLOODY MARY BAR, O HEY!   Pros: breakfast and booze, huge portions ( I got a side of oatmeal and it was double a meal portion), CHEAP!!!!, Early hours   Cons: Parking is a bitch, slower (a huge party sat before us though)   Def will be back for some day drinking

rgW1ASDNdoipNG5ABW1fZQ.text: I called to see how many draft beers they had on tap, Girl says "I'm not sure. I'm new." and hangs up on me! I called back and asked for a manager and she wouldn't even give me that! Not going here! Terrible customer service!!

ycuF0HpID8jbCz5sqR8RYw.text: HORRIBLE ALL AROUND!!!!! Came in on a Sunday morning for breakfast around 1045, walked in and the girl said it would be a ten minute wait. We sat at the bar to wait so she forgot about us. After about 25 minutes or so we asked how long and she took us to the booth that was open for about 23 minutes. Went to the table, sat there for about another 20 minutes with our menus folded at the end of the table. After we had a table sit down next to is and get service right away we asked why nobody has come over. The waitress was confused and didn't know why. Waitress didn't write down our order and had to come back and ask what we got. Food was ehhh.....FINALLY left around 1230, so it took almost 2 hours to have a horrible experience.

vKejbUSBPCCcZ8CE4Cp2Wg.text: Great place to watch a game. Friendly staff went out of their way to get my game on even though the Steelers were on at the same time.

lkqrciusvggULRYQObK21Q.text: Great food and atmosphere. Sweet potato waffle fries are the best. Great for Pirate games.

YoRxQuBbt7Gz4IjAM586Ag.text: This place is just average. The service is subpar at best and the waitresses always seem rushed. However, their wings and wing flavors are good, and they have so many tv's there isn't a bad seat in the house if you're there for a game. Now that the parking lot across the street is gone, good luck looking for a spot. I would go back, but only for the wings and the spicy cheese bites.

T4ls8oRcWSTJN4yxm5b6UA.text: Has become one of my favorite breakfast spots.  Was already one of my favorite places to watch a game (TVs cover ever imch of this place - just get there early!).  Great bar food, friendly staff.

brpTdxJvxqSytz8PeVTayA.text: I have been to Cain's several times and had great experiences. Food is wonderful, service is friendly and I love the huge selection of beer.  So disappointed yesterday when I took home my delicious to go order. Got to my last piece of pastrami smoked salmon point and pulled a long piece of knotted out black hair out if my mouth! So gross!

01qybplit7CBqgUoQS-_5w.text: Giant portions and a great selection for breakfast lunch and dinner. Huge beer selection which is a little overpriced but the variety makes it tolerable. Would definitely recommend the Bloody Mary bar on the weekends. Only downside is lunch isn't served till noon on weekends.

DuZd0VE4AKF8E7oyfIUWXg.text: From the moment we walked in I knew we were in for in for an interesting experience. Instead of being greeted with a smiling, friendly "Hi, welcome to cains" we were greeted with a frantically working, unhelpful, stressed out hostess who had no clue how to deal with the influx of people. We were there during a breakfast rush. When we walked in the hostess told us that it would be 45 minutes for the kitchen to prepare our food. Since we had known cains for their delicious breakfast, we thought the wait would be worth it. But an hour and fifteen minutes later we get our food. My Breakfast burrito tasted like nothing and a our food was cold. The only good thing about the experience was the warm donuts. Poor service, crappy food. Overall not the way a restaurant should be run.

i8XLyOjsf_G9Fouaob8Mag.text: Cain's has a great sports bar feel. Lots of TV's to watch all the games on. The food is excellent and the entire restaurant is clean, modern and well maintained. The kitchen is open until 2am so it's a great place to stop late night on your way home to get a pint and some food.

Pq-9dGXXs_p6SECx93m2fA.text: By far the best bar I have been to while I stayed at my sisters for my Vacay... All I have to say is the waitress that helped me rocks ... And the bartender that helped me yesterday rocks too... Thanks for the Fire Cracker drink it was awesome. I hope this gets to them. I really do.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Fire Cracker
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Good food... Big burger

3-P6i9hH28hvrFahOl61gg.text: Recently went back to give Cain's another shot. Even though the service was bad the last time I was there, the food was always good. I haven't given the dining room a second try yet, but when I sat in the bar the service was actually good. The bartender was attentive and I never had a problem getting his attention if I needed anything. The food was good, it was served fast, and the portions were huge as usual. Although I am still a bit hesitant to sit in the dining room, I will definitely go back again after this recent experience to at least sit in the bar area.

F0t9IBVDptnIaumGPvVzXQ.text: My husband and I have been here a few times, but last evening we ordered Grubhub.  The delivery was timely, so no problems there.  I had the buffalo chicken dip which is AMAZING.  It has just the right amount of zip to it.  I also had the fish sandwich with sweet potato waffle fries.  They forgot my tartar sauce which was kind of a bummer and the fries were a tad soggy.  Both were still tasty.  My husband had a chef salad and again, they forgot the dressing.  My guess is that the dressing and my tartar sauce were left somewhere together.  If an also say that my in house experiences have also been positive.  The wait staff are always pleasant, even when busy.  It's a good, local place for some good food.

RcW11yiyiWoOW0zTPK2r2g.text: This place used to be very good. The service was slow and we were given the wrong check. Then they started getting very cheap on the food. No longer offering fresh cut fries and the amount of sauce on the wings is almost no existent.   Looks like they are cutting corners to make more money. Not sure if we will be back

vvFqMo3A_fHhaQhKjX7kBg.text: Stopped for something to eat on the way home from a steeler game. They have a pretty large menu but I just wanted something small. I went with the chili and we shared the mozzarella sticks. They mozzarella sticks were great! Actually like really good. They were fresh so it was like a thick stick of cheese. The chili was meh... My fiance got a burger which looked good. I did like the fresh cut fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mozzarella sticks
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burger and fries
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Just ok chili

xL6UosfqiXunJpb8cJ3Aow.text: Well, Cain's is ruined. AMPD Group came in and made changes. Portion sizes are smaller, menu is destroyed, prices increased, and happy hour is basically gone. It was fun while it lasted, just go elsewhere now.

SOHatomAlDeBN0KWlkwTUw.text: Watched the Pirates with friends on a Sunday.  The bartenders were great!   The food was great!   I ordered their garlic / parm / hot wings per the recommendation of my bartender.  Great order.  The beer - I mixed up between a hoppy IPA and a 50/50 sour.   They have some beers on tap I have not seen at other bars.  You should check it out.   Sunday - the meters are free :-) - (Don't tell anyone).

519FygHhScRUdn9ryB3Yew.text: So sad.  Cain's used to be a hoppin' place with great food.  One of the long standing authentically local Dormont establishments.  It has been here for decades.  This new restaurant group that bought it has completely ruined it.  The "Local" name - is just a slap in the face.  It's now a bad chain.  I fear that Cain's won't last long now.  The place has no vibe at all - it was dead - nearly empty - on a Friday night.  We were seated, yet after 15 minutes no one had come back to our table.  Service is terrible.  Aside from that, the prices are absolutely absurd.  Meals come with homemade chips now, not fries and cost on average about $13-14.  Sorry, but I am not paying $14 for a French dip, Rueben, or Burger and a side of chips.  Appetizers - how about $11 for fried pickles!!!  Yes, Pickles!!!  I am just so sad that Cain's sold out to this restaurant group - it used to be a great "local" place to eat, drink, and watch games.  I don't want to say to stay away because I want Dormont businesses to succeed, but I will honestly never return and I live within walking distance.

q2UHjq_utHS5PtfnKn0mwQ.text: Used to be a great neighborhood bar. The new management company reduced the menu and clearly is focused on profit. Their appetizers are extremely small, and the quality of the food has went way downhill. It's a shame because used to be a great hangout spot with great food options, steak nights, etc. we recently showed up on a Friday night for a Pitt football game and there were no other sporting events that night (it was Friday). We didn't get the game turned on until 10 minutes after it started. Is still a great place to drink and the bartenders are great and servers are nice, but it is clearly poorly managed. Head up to some other spots for better options.

jdVlkI1SMLcATPGKhlcbOw.text: I have always liked Cain's food, drinks, and service. I was excited that there was a new owner, but admittedly hesitant to visit. I decided, what better way to see a great sports bar in its greatest form than to visit during a big sporting event... the WORLD Cup Final. I walked into a packed place with spirits high. They were immediately crushed after waiting at a table with two others for about 20 minutes before my drink order was placed. I was told there was only one server for the entire bar area, again, during the World Cup Final. The beer menu was good, but I ordered a beer that was 4.5% and it was served in a 10oz glass. In fact, most beer (barring Miller Lite, Coors, Yuengling etc) was served in a glass less than a pint. It was 11am and there were only brunch menus on the table. Asking if there were things like fries or wings, I was told that they don't switch over to lunch until 2pm and couldn't make fries. I found the closest thing to a lunch item on the menu which was a burger with an egg on it. I ordered it at half time--noon. Soccer games are 90 mins as you might know, so I had 45 minutes to get my food and enjoy it before the game was over. I asked approximately how long it would take and was told 15/20 minutes. 50 minutes later, my food came. It was a good burger and that's about the only good thing I can say about Cain's. I live walking distance from the place and could be a regular, but unfortunately I won't be. I'll be going to Jameson's down the street for amazing food, drinks, service, and atmosphere from now on.

ZHmCTdK9HXh5sJn_JQs4JQ.text: Went to Cain's today for breakfast and was so excited to pick from the crazy assortment of French toast they have. However, they changed the menu! A friend and I could not decide and decided to order french toast and biscuists and gravy. This did not dissapont. You could smell the cinnamon from the French toast and the bread was just the right amount of softness without being soggy. The biscuits and gravy was fantastic. The salty spice mixture of the sausage combined with the sweet butteriness of the biscuits worked perfectly. Cain's again did not dissapont!

3G_n49cORsx-lNkNM2e_ZQ.text: Cain's is okay, but I probably won't be back unless I'm with others who insist. The prices are absolutely absurd for the kind of establishment this is. I wouldn't be happy to pay $10 for a cheese sticks appetizer at an upscale place, but to do it at a divey bar/restaurant? YIKES. Huge turn off and I am kind of still in shock at how much their cheap food costs and definitely knocked off a star because of this. Not a single appetizer is under $10, let alone the prices of the actual meals. I'll be heading down the road to the many places on Washington next time for similar fare and at least one place that has a similar atmosphere at much more reasonable prices.  Plus, Cain's is LOUD. Too loud.   My food was ok. The loaded pulled pork nachos were delicious, but again, overpriced at $13.00. My steak wrap had very good steak, but not enough of it to actually fill the wrap. Probably about 1/3-1/2 of the wrap was just lettuce and cheese. The onion rings were good, though, and a generous portion. My friend's salmon wrap did not suffer the same problem as mine, and was chock full of fish.  I guess go if you want to overpay like crazy for American style fare you can find basically anywhere?

3sN-erAtqdHSzF9VP_V5Lg.text: This bar was part of the Dormont Bar Crawl. This was one of the last bars we had to mark off on our crawl. I was with a group of people and I was the first one in and kindly waited for the rest of my party to come in. Someone yelled my name and I went to go say hi to a friend I have not seen in a while. While speaking with her, I was notified that one of my friends could not get in because , " he did not have a valid id" - My friend is from Aruba and came into town to visit. He was able to get into all the other bars without a problem.   The guy at the door would not give my friend the time of day to explain his Identification. The guy at the door stated, " You need a passport."  - What type of ignorant response is that? For a bar owner to be that rude to a potential customer is uncalled for.   So I am glad that none of us bought drinks in that establishment. I will never step foot into that place again. I will continue to write about this place until it is known for its discriminatory actions.

9IXqw4amfXIqmEL5giuwcA.text: Two years after giving Cain's 5 stars, I'm sorry to say that is no longer the case.  One of my favorite places to drink and eat is now off of the list.  This review is NO reflection on the staff.  Each and every one of them take care of their customers and are genuinely concerned about the customer experience.  However, since ownership changed, food quality has tanked while prices remain the same or higher.  $11 for 5 chicken fingers no bigger than my thumb.  $10 for a basic cheeseburger smaller than a Wendys Single.  I understand the need for change.  I understand a large menu and portion sizes can reduce profits.  But reduction in quality without a reduction in price is too big of a change for me.

nq9omWVdJaSDw_8GbypUtw.text: Great atmosphere for breakfast ! Loved the bloody Mary bar ! Thanks Dana  would love to see Chris and Aaron again

DcjRqMo1tug5HwozWWzamg.text: Foods okay most of the time depends on the cooks I feel like. I think all the employees are pretty good but So that's why it gets 4 stars foods expensive and most of the time I feel like it could be better I don't recommend the chicken fingers. Come on Wednesday after 7 pm for the wings there not to bad. I don't really leave reviews but I feel like they need more negative reviews to make the place better. Cold food after a 45 minute wait is ridiculous   . A lot of other places within a couple of miles that seem to out due the food. The employees and environment are great tho if your just looking for drinks have to try a few more things but from what I've tried I've never been like wow that's really good. The breakfast is good tho 4/5 I recommend, that can be busy tho.  But enough ranting give em a shot see how you feel about it. "Corporate bar"

KeMTI3xoPJ6Nf-dvnz5uwA.text: I have been here a few times and in general thought more highly of the place than what I'm going to rate it now (and I would rate it lower if it weren't better experiences prior to my last visit). In general, this is a nice looking bar, with large and viewable, nice TVs, plus decent food with large portions. I especially recommend getting their enormous mozzarella sticks!  My problem was with our last trip this past Sunday. Service was a tad slow, but acceptable. The real issue was due to the fries. They look fresh cut, delicious looking, and just spudtacular. But they were not delicious. In fact, they were flat out gross and almost tasted like they had a strong chemical flavor and odor to boot. I think we can rule out the fryer if it was shared with the fish as it tasted fine. They were possibly the worst tasting fries I've ever had. I thought I was going to be poisoned or something if I ate more than the two I tried.  I've had their fries in the past and don't recall anything of the sort described previously. We didn't eat anymore of them (and I'm pretty sure no one else at the table ate more than a few of the fries tha came with their dishes). Hopefully this was a fluke, but it is concerning regardless.

UGlzJlQOPTbmEvt9AWbGsw.text: Absolutely awful. We came here on a Sunday around noon and the brunch was already done. Service was terrible and the food was even worse. The pretzels had more salt than a penndot storage facility. My chicken fingers came out unrecognizable - burnt, flat,  and fish shaped. The nachos had no cheese, the pierogies were overfried mrs. Ts freezer pierogies, and the mimosas were straight orange juice. On top of that Ampd just bought this dump and the new menu has barely changed but raised all the prices.   Stay away and save your money.

7roQgtlJlHaf0x0CfouTSg.text: WOW! Amazing service and food. One of the best bloody Mary's I've had in Pittsburgh. The GM was so personable and welcoming, the bartenders and servers were incredibly helpful and friendly. Didn't know what to order and was pointed in the right direction. I find it hard to believe that anything on the menu is bad! I wish I could give more than 5 stars

N4haC5V9Q2uFWSswEv576A.text: Have to dock stars off my previous review for the absurd prices. Every appetizer is $10 now? Burger almost $15?  Wow did the prices go way up. Like a previous reviewer wrote, 20% more than similar establishments in the area. Not a bad place to grab a drink, but avoid the overpriced food.

OGxEpLX6-jMkxM1_we3fag.text: We had a party at Cain's on a night they have all you can eat crab legs. We had over 20 people show up to enjoy good company and food.  The food was amazing!!  Crab legs kept coming out as we needed them, even with this many people we had no delay in our food. The service was super friendly and the atmosphere in the back room was very relaxed. I was nervous bringing my kids, but there was no problem at all and the  just loved the food also.  When desert came, I have to say I was totally floored with the banana foster, it was just heavenly.   I highly recommend stopping in and getting a fabulous meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana Foster -- just amazing, you have to try this. It is a piece of heaven.
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. All you can eat crab legs. First plate with a potato and coleslaw. Don&#39;t forget to leave room for desert!
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Started with a very tasty salad.

XjWUUGWPtFMNPKXXbpjnag.text: Cain's is a great local bar/restaurant located right in the heart of Dormont. I have been here a few times over the years because it is relatively close to my parent's house and have never had a bad experience. A group of 12 of use went on Sunday afternoon for my grandfather's birthday. We made reservations ahead of time and they were very accommodating to our group and it wasn't too crowded. We missed the brunch (it ends at 12 on Sunday) but still were able to make mimosas & bloody Mary's from the mimosa/bloody mary bar. I made a mimosa and my dad had the bloody mary bar. Both were pretty good!   For lunch, I ordered a cheeseburger with sweet potato fries. The cheeseburger was just OK but I really enjoyed the fries! We also got an order of the hot garlic parmesan wings for the table to share, which were amazing! Next time I come back I will for sure order wings again. Last but not least, our waitress, Kimmy was great! She was very helpful and was so sweet to my 96 year old grandfather! We couldn't have asked for a better waitress to help him celebrate his birthday.

TJ-GLbZJh3Xz8JOvHrFO7g.text: What has happened to this place? I've seen the ups and downs of Cain's over the last 15 years, the bathroom display I saw on Monday afternoon during the Pitt bowl game, likely could've closed the restaurant had the wrong (or right?) person seen it.  A sewage odor from the front door, rust dripping on the floor from the urinal, two holes in the wall next to the second urinal.  How can you serve food in those restaurant conditions? This restaurant has been under new ownership for months, I fear it won't be around much longer

EMdnWoyCdIGlsu0Q7QuJZA.text: Really bad food and bad service.  New owners ruined this place. They also ruined the restaurant at cool springs.  Can't  believe they have neen successful with othe establishments. They need new leadership that knows what they are doing

3MWK29gRhLJj4WyLeCqlLQ.text: I have to admit, when i read the most recent reviews of Cain's, i was skeptical. It seemed like the service and food quality has declined since Cain's first opened. I am here to let you know that i was delightfully impressed with my experience at Cain's. My coworkers and i met here for breakfast last Saturday. When i walked in, the place was pretty empty, but nice and cozy. I was told our group could either sit in the bar area or the dining room. We chose the dining room because it was quieter. Upon first glance, i noticed they had a Bloody Mary and mimosa bar. The Bloody Mary bar wasn't as extravagant as other places I'd been to, but it had all the necessary basics. I got a Bloody Mary and made it to my liking!   I will say that Cain's has a lot of breakfast food options... sandwiches, pancakes, waffles, frittatas, flatbreads, burritos, Benedict's.. and i could keep going. I settled on a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. I know it sounds basic, but you could get a pretzel bun as an option for bread, so they had me sold! My sandwich had a ton of bacon. The cheese and egg weren't lacking either. It was so good! The sandwich cake with home fries, which were nothing exciting. I skipped those and just ate my sandwich.   Our server Jill was new, but she was prompt and super friendly. I would definitely go back to Cain's again. I had a really great experience!

t7fMhfc8Xt0zgVibIO_d1Q.text: Great little spot. Especially good if you're a Liverpool FC fan, they have a nice crew that shows up for games. Open early to accommodate as well.

YCHoqumobFpgzKXZuABBeQ.text: Hidden gem of the South Hills! This is our go-to neighborhood restaurant and bar, whether we want to grab a drink after work, or brunch on the weekend. Excellent draft list - they have a great variety. It's the perfect place to watch a game. Their food is far above expectations from a typical sports bar - everything is homemade and really fresh. Some of my favorite are the fried shrimp (HUGE and very fresh), pierogies (homemade), crab cake eggs Benedict, and the french toast bowls. Always excellent service as well!

N1AzKQ04G7_OlYJ7adOd3Q.text: Great place to watch a Steeler game. NFL Sunday ticket package as well for your out of town/fantasy games, plus numerous, new, big screen TVs. You can't miss a beat here and you should always expect for there to be at least one TV with your game on it. Bartender was super polite in making sure everyone had their game on. Really enjoyed the extremely lengthy draft list -- one of the deeper draft lists that I've seen in awhile.  Had numerous craft & seasonal winter drafts. Food was also very solid. I had a stuffed banana pepper sandwich with some homemade potato chips. Definitely recommend this. One thing that was a little bit of a downer was trying to split the bill at the end of the night. Server was extremely sweet and obviously busy, but we were presented a bill that was $50 more than what we would expect. Was definitely not ours -- and then staff had a hard time concretely putting together our final bill.  Just need to take better notes or electronically tab as we go. That took a half star away from the day, but I also take a half star away for the overall appearance that could use a little love and care. Bathroom kind of beat. Saw a few booth seats that were torn. Just a few touch up items and little clean up on service, and then I'm a huge fan...

th3lhJKDWhQGrkw-6wl2iQ.text: Go for shots and beers. Skip the food. If you're there later in the evening there is a chance to hear some smooth reggae beats over the speakers

BsYuOxJu-_UwHI8t4zUMtg.text: Meh, I've never had an exceptional experience here.  Some pros are it's location and it's proximity to me and the variety of the menu. I like their offerings and when you look at the menu, it looks fantastic. However, some cons are the incredibly slow service and the food is just not that great.   I've been here on many occasions and it's never really my first pick. But then you look at the menu, and you think for a second it might turn out just fine. It always goes downhill after you're seated. Incredibly long wait times for the wait staff to get your drinks, your orders, and then your food. Plan to be here a few hours.   My last visit was during brunch. Boy does the brunch menu look fantastic, but execution just was not there. I ordered the chicken and waffle. If you like your chicken extra extra extra crispy, you might enjoy their chicken. If you like a dense waffle, you might like their waffles. For me, everything was just a bit too tough to chew on. I will say the flavors were ok, but the texture ruined it for me.   Overall, I'm not a fan. I return for its central location and somehow, the online menu always lures me in to only make a fool out of me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken and waffle

IU8V9Vt5qe3LV-Zm1_2Svw.text: I had some beers and dinner here on a Thursday night. They have a really good selection of craft beers and a nice list that describes a little about the beers to help you make a choice. On Thursday craft beers are $2 off, which is a pretty good deal.   They have a big menu as others have noted, but Thursday was prime rib special night with a choice of prime rib plate or prime rib hoagie. I got the hoagie which came with steak fries. The hoagies was really big and I had to cut it in three pieces. There was a lot of meat and melted cheese, but it was real dry. I was expecting a little more moist and juicy prime rib. The steak fries were ok, but did not taste like they were from freshly cut potatoes.   Service was good at the bar. The food took a little while to get to me, but I didn't care much since I wasn't in a rush.   The place was pretty crowded and friendly. There are a lot of screens playing different games. This is a nice, fun place to relax.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Prime rib hoagie--special on Thursday for $12.99. A big serving, but a little on the dry side.

pk3dmWO4KAGuObzo-8OVjA.text: Had a brunch reservation via Open Table and they didn't honor it. Told us their dining area was closed. They just looked at us like we were from another planet. Kitchen was great about a year ago but last 2 times there it was a disaster. The nice guy who used to run the place must've left or sold it. Understaffed/ filthy/ rude. Should be 0 stars or about negative -5.

-ZoeN0DCdDvmP7kZ65Xq4Q.text: Cain's Saloon: A once great establishment. I've been a Dormont resident for four years and used to always love visiting this bar. They had great service, great French onion soup, and great wings. Sadly, that is no longer the case. Upon being purchased by Local, this place divulged into utter chaos and mismanagement. Takes eons to get a servers attention, proper utensils are difficult to come by, and the bathroom smells like the Old Mill from Kennywood. I would recommend going to Jamison's bar one block over for a far superior experience.

LzFXQpiM2mMLnik0uI6wTQ.text: What is going on with the bathrooms? They smell absolutly horrendous. I am sitting in the main dining room and the smell is wafting out and it is gag worthy. This isn't a new problem either. It's been like this for months.

ofmxc077ayYwm51g5m6ZeQ.text: Came for Sunday brunch and on their website it says it is until 2pm. When we showed up at 1:05 we were told they are now only serving brunch till 1pm. Kind of disappointing as it was on their website and on the specials sheet right on the table that is was till 2pm and we were only 5 minutes past 1pm. They didn't even seem to care and we ended up leaving and getting brunch elsewhere.

FOxVhLWG-ETI0BxY7bnesw.text: Used to love coming here on Wednesday night for the wings. The place would consistently be packed with people; now it's pretty dead. Since the new owners took over, the service and food quality have definitely diminished. For example, the wing flavors are pretty bland now. And it takes entirely too long for the food to come out. Greg is still at the bar and does a nice job. Also, don't understand how the men's room is in such poor condition - the wall has been busted out for over a year. Cmon now guys.

437FCCkylQLGD15itnf-PQ.text: I can barely write this because I'm so dang full.  I'd really give this place 3.5 stars.  Huge beer selection and the food - wow!  are the portions huge and it's really good bar food.    Our waitress was adorable and very attentive. I still can't get over how huge the sandwich was.  To drink I got the leinenkugel grapefruit shandy and it light and delightful it was practically a health drink :-)   For dinner I got the Cain's Club which is turkey breast, peppered bacon, and egg with pepper jack, lettuce, tomato, and horsey sauce served on a pretzel bun. First of all, let's be real - everything tastes better with an egg on it-I just wish there was a little more horsey sauce  on it but it was huge and the bread was so good!    My hubby got the Pittsburgher which is a 1/2 pound burger (he got it as a turkey burger) topped with sauteed onions, 3 pierogies, cheddar cheese and horseradish sauce.  So crazy.    All their sandwiches come with 1 side item - I opted for the onion rings and hubby got the sweet potato waffle fries - both were amazing. I seriously can't breathe because I'm so full.    If you're looking for great bar food - lots of beer selection and a great staff - you should come here. You won't leave hungry ....

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The pittsburger
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The cain&#39;s club - yep that&#39;s an egg in there

p1V3FTn_zJiWPAvo6Jxojg.text: Shopping in Dormont; had to wait over an hour for purchase to be ready.  Needed to eat and Cain's was one of a couple suggested. Very glad we went there for a late lunch. This place is very inviting as soon as you walk in the door. First thing I noticed was how clean and bright it was. Jovan welcomes you and makes you feel very comfortable. He's knowledgeable of all the drinks and menu; and helpful to new customers...like us! Food was very good. We have a large family and will be back!

HFnMFW6bwyaAVHVhzrZzoQ.text: I'm actually sad to write this. Cain's was the best brunch in Pittsburgh. I reviewed this place at five stars four years ago. Since then I've seen it go downhill pretty drastically. Our service today was incredibly slow - 25 minutes to get drinks! We asked to order 15 minutes after that and were told no, as out server had to take other orders first. The once-famous bloody Mary bar was barely stocked and had much fewer to select from.   Our food arrived in advance of our silverware and was cold. Ever have cold eggs? It's awful. The server dropped the food and never once checked on us again. 45 minutes later we finally managed to flag him down and pay for our cold food. Although we had our cards out and ready to go, he still kept us waiting after dropping off the checks.   Tl;Dr: used to be the best. Now among the worst. Go somewhere else.

GWZrbtE1x5a0NzhXFkiZ9Q.text: Went tonight for a quick salad. Ordered the Caesar salad with salmon. The salad came with maybe 3-4oz of salmon. I didn't pay much attention to the price but when my bill came it was an $18 salad. It was good but not worth $18.

VI2EX5lXjxSx_b7v9mvnyg.text: Always love this place! One of my go to favorites. Tonight was a build your own burger with grilled onions,  pepper jack cheese, and cappicola, loved it! Especially with Ranch dressing!! Family had gourmet Mac and cheese with pulled pork, bbq sauce, fried onions, creamy greatness!!! Parents had the Cuban sandwich, with roasted pork, ham, Swiss cheese, pickles. Both loved it, a must try if you haven't had one. Dad had French Onion Soup for an appetizer, 5 stars for that!! The broth was so aromatic, onions were delicious, topped with melted provolone cheese! Cain's is always a winner!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Cuban!!!! Delicious!!
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac and Cheese with bbq pulled pork, fried onions!!
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great burger with grilled onions, cappicola, pepper jack! Yesssss!

WDZgSa5bl896aGB5_7DpzQ.text: Gave Cain's another try with new owner -made reservation for Friday June 1 at 7:00 for my mothers 82 birthday .got their only to fibd out they had no clue what I was talking about- they put tables together and gave us one waitress- needless to say she was overwhelmed by us - appetizers - no zucchini on a Friday  come on- half of the food came out cold undercooked and let's just say it was bad - manger Courtney came over apologizing saying computers were down-- everyone knew she was lying - gave us 15% off our bill  but she could have given  us free food would not have matter - The only good thing I could say is the bouncer open the door that's the only good thing about Cain's

s-iB4IRhhiTVqVrxKymqnQ.text: Always love stopping at Cains for Happy Hour. Stopped in a month ago and food was great as we had a few appetizers and wings. We did have an issue as on their website it said wing special started at 5 but in Cains it said 7. The waitress said yes it is incorrect and people complain about it all the time but then just let it drop. So when we went last night it was nice to see they moved it to 5 to match the website.    Wings were great as always and stuffed banana peppers always hit the spot a d are very filling for the price. My wife got the fried zucchini and we couldn't believe the portion size. 2 hours sitting and drinking with friends for 35 bucks. Great deal and a great time.

dFphTfXZHtB00q_5pd9iLA.text: I've been going to Cains for a very long time. This place used to be filled with good food, good people, and good music!  Went almost every Wednesday with friends for wing night. Everyone loved it (especially me because they had a fab volcano sauce super hot!!) Since the ownership changed it is terrible! The servers come around with grumpy attitudes. You kinda want to leave because they suck so bad. The salad dressing (used to be homemade and awesome) now straight outta some bottle that they over freeze because it comes out solid. Gross. Then the wings seem cooked well and not much changed there, but the sauces are horrible. Disgusting watered down, no flavor....how does this happen.  Note to new owner...if you're going to buy something great, then make it suck, change the name of the place. Your attempt of following in the previous owners footsteps is far lacking. The only decent thing you held onto were a few bartenders who are always nice.

qpWMufEKhQFNeN9HttdYKg.text: I would give less than 1 star if I could. Definitely the worst restaurant I've been to in Pittsburgh. It's hard to mess up a simple breakfast but they did it. Wait took over an hour and a half.   Don't bother coming here.

c6MEN41PLOC7XrlRuy7lpw.text: Went to Cain's for an after party with work friends and it was during the Penn State Pitt Game which they had on a few TVs which we liked! Bunch of tvs for sporting events which was nice. The drink list and lost had a lot of nice surprising items and a good selection. I ordered the buffalo chicken dip and it came with tortilla chips and pita bread-a bunch of us shared it and thought it was really good! I didn't have time to try anything else on the menu so I will be back in the future to try some more items! One bartender was very friendly and polite and another seemed overwhelmed and a bit annoyed with the amount of people in the bar that afternoon. Overall it is a decent place to stop at if you want to watch a sporting event and try some tasty food and drinks with friends.

AMmRRDe_s5C9Qq023Frgpg.text: They have a brand new appetizer they're doing, Pub Eggrolls! They are fantastic! Ham, Swiss and a pickle in an egg roll with whole grain mustard goes together wonderful! Great job Cain's!

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody Mary with horseradish and pepper vodkas!
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Farmers Breakfast with a side of sausage gravy
Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody Mary Bar!

QBjmgQPOkvRPtIdnHJV8TA.text: I have had a few good experiences with takeout so I suggested Cain's when  my dad said he would take me out for lunch. Thank heaven my pop is a forgiving man.  Food was ok. but how in the world is the food hotter when I get take out?  So at first service was good, accommodating us to sit in the back as my dad is disabled and can't sit at the high tops and helping him select a beer.  My dad ordered the Codfather which states on the menu that is comes with chips and a pickle spear. He just said the sandwich when the server said, "It comes with chips but you can get another side instead"  My dad showed interest and asked, what side and the server showed him on the menu the list of sides and he choose Mac and cheese.  As I ordered my burger, I asked if it was also eligible for a switch out for a side and was told yes so I got the Brussels sprouts; which were okay. Btw the mac and cheese was just sauce over rotini and was lukewarm at best. Still better than the homemade chips. And, to be clear, there were no chips brought to us.  Turns out, the only switch was a bait and switch. $42 for a bill and each side was charged! $6 for the Mac and $4 for the sprouts.  My dad said nicely, "what happened? You offered the side as a switch. "The server's response? "Oh no, you choose to order the sides and the price is on the menu"  If this was the case, we should have been served the chips that came with the sandwich. Also, remember, my father only even saw the sides AFTER the server told him he could have them in lieu of the chips.   so they got an extra $10 and lost our office's take out business too.

ubsjNV1o5GcIQ-rTbHyzJg.text: We were hoping to sit on the roof top bar but it wasn't open.   The bar and restaurant was not crowded at all We were there on a Monday night.  Food was just ok but mixed drink mojito was awful.  Switched to beer to be safe.  Service was not good either.  Apparently the waitress and bartender didn't like each other and we had to hear all about it.  Parts of our order were forgotten and we had to keep asking for things.  Maybe I know why it was practically empty??  I don't care to go back.

azvh7frx8eBgHHUGpPgoMw.text: I love Cain's! Always have. It's walking distance for me, so I'm always stopping by.  The menu is pretty extensive, and although It is directly on Liberty it's no way close to being a dive bar. It's always clean, the service is normally spot on as well.  I love, and I mean love the sweet potato fries. They also have killer flatbreads, and (my favorite)...salmon sandwich.  My complete go to is the sweet and sour Brussel sprouts. Last time I came they somehow had butter on them which was a bummer, so next time I'll be sure to specify!   This place gets pretty busy for games, and they usually have $2.50 miller/bud specials during those times. I kinda wish their beers were just a wee bit cheaper all the time, I never like paying $6 for a beer but it's nice to just stop in and relax for a bit.  They have brunch, which I have yet to check out.   They have an Instagram which posts all their specials as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cain's Local Bar + Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon Club Sandwich

cVUEjsYPssE1PzPVuyLmIw.text: Went there to watch the Steeler game and bartender refused to put the volume on for the game. Being in sales and ordering lunches for offices daily  it was the worst and rude experience I  have ever witnessed. The food was marginal at best and the service was pathetic. There are alot better places to spend your money on west liberty ave. I wish there was negative stars.

vV57Id-mApn-dz7J8SGeGg.text: After PSL basketball games, we like to grab a bite or drink here. They always have space for us and always bring over pitches of water for us to just drink down since we just ran for an hour. We never come for happy hour, so the daily special for beer is normally modelo , I don't like it so I just get an angry orchard or something .  I always get wings here . They are super filling but also lite enough after the game. This refer is based on when we come after the games. The wings have great flavor and they come with ranch and celery and carrots  too . I haven't had anything else to be honest . My boyfriend had the flatbread and it was not enough food for him but with wings, it is plenty.   Again the services is always good when we come in with a big group and they always joke with us so it's a great damn time.

yBnq557TwvbhoWRM5jUWyw.text: Awful bland mediocre burgers. Messed up my order and refused to make it right even though it was their mistake. Incredibly rude. Terrible service. Will never patronize this establishment. Jamison's is just a few steps away and infinitely better !

Kk4cFq7VbwW9KcyaGB_WHA.text: Cain's is a nice location hangout with some decent food.  The inside is in need of some improvements, but still makes for a good gamespot.  If you go on a game night be sure to get there early, as it can get pretty packed.  The food is pretty average overall.  Many of the items they have are just missing a little bit.  Their buffalo chicken dip is good, but needs more hot sauce for some heat.  Their cheese sticks are one of their signature item because they are enormous.  While they make for a good picture, the size makes the cheese overwhelming.  The French dip, Reuben, and cheesesteak are 3 of the better things I have had here.  The burgers do not taste fresh and are never cooked properly.

ta_ZqVJpWySAu7hn3ktQiA.text: Sorry to say.... But we've been back to Cains a couple of times recently...both times for dinner-and it's not the same.  From a five star to a three. It's not bad. Still very nice waitresses. But not crazy about the new menu selections, prices, and wait time for the meal. It's not bad. But now it is 'average'. It's not bad....

RrpPwlVzkh0ZvOAb2p_zkw.text: I came here recently for a social event, and it was okay. Thoroughly average bar food.  A decent happy hour (1/2 price appetizers and $1 off drafts), and in a lively part of Dormont.  Unfortunately, lively also means tough parking. By some miracle I did get one right out front, but if you don't enjoy parallel parking on a busy street or finding side street parking, buckle up.

H-fc-1eokfYV43SCRqBZ7w.text: Total disappointment, again, always. I don't know why I keep trying to give Cain's another try but this time I'm done for good.  I'm not sure what the AMPED group is doing to this new venture of theirs but they need to get it together stat.  Attached is the Irish coffee I was served during brunch today. I don't even know how to describe it other than the worst tasting gritty drink I've ever had. Food also eh. Erasing this place from my mind and will never step foot in here again.
